greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least common multiple divided by greatest common divisor of the integer partition with Heinz number n > 1.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1,...,y_k) is prime(y_1)*...*prime(y_k).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to Heinz numbers
example: 63 is the Heinz number of (4,2,2), which has LCM 4 and GCD 2, so a(63) = 4/2 = 2.
91 is the Heinz number of (6,4), which has LCM 12 and GCD 2, so a(91) = 12/2 = 6.
program: (PARI) A316431(n) = if(1==n,1,my(pis = apply(p -> primepi(p), factor(n)[, 1]~)); lcm(pis)/gcd(pis)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 06 2018
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 02 2018
